key_risks: Regulatory and compliance issues, including fines and compensation payments
Customer service complaints and poor complaint handling
Exposure to market volatility and inconsistent financial performance
Intense competitive pressures from traditional insurers and fintech entrants
controversies: Fined £2.8 million and paid £60 million in compensation for poor administrative procedures
Significant customer complaints regarding long wait times and unresolved issues
environmental_issues: Commitment to ESG principles and net-zero investment targets by 2030
social_issues: Poor customer service and complaint handling
Long wait times and unresolved customer issues
governance_issues: Challenges in improving risk profile and divesting non-core operations

sources.title: FSA fines Aegon UK £2.8 million for multiple control failings
sources.snippet: UK regulator the Financial Services Authority (FSA) has announced it has fined the UK arm of Dutch insurance firm Aegon £2.8 million for controls failings. The insurance firm, which previously operated as Scottish Equitable until a recent rebrand, will also pay £60 million in redress to customers.

sources.snippet: Calling Aegon involves waiting on hold for up to 2 hours before reaching someone. A formal complaint has been raised, prioritised, and escalated, yet after 6 weeks I'm still waiting for a response.
